intro: Schrankia berlandieri, commonly known as the Mexican senna, is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is native to Mexico and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant produces pods that contain seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Schrankia berlandieri is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a food source for certain insects.
